docs.snippet: As a crucial election nears, leaders like Matteo Renzi are on high alert for fake news and foreign meddling.

headline.print_headline: Italy Fears Outsiders Will Meddle In Its Voting
headline.main: Italy, Bracing for Electoral Season of Fake News, Demands Facebook’s Help

docs.snippet: It was not clear whether telecommunications providers would comply with the government’s request, which an official said had come from the country’s spy agency.

headline.print_headline: Afghanistan Acts to Ban WhatsApp, but Claims Move Is Temporary
headline.main: Afghanistan Acts to Ban WhatsApp, but Claims Move Is Temporary

docs.snippet: SoftBank is offering to buy shares in Uber at a 30 percent markdown. Investors could cash out, but the promise of more could cloud their thinking.

headline.print_headline: Uber Backers Face a Dilemma: To Sell or Not to Sell
headline.main: Uber Backers Face a Dilemma: To Sell or Not to Sell

docs.snippet: Social media gets all the attention for polarization, but TV is doing more than its share.
An acquisition deal is a lucky break for Time Inc.’s shareholders because its go-it-alone strategy looked doomed.

headline.print_headline: Meredith’s Persistence Pays Off for Time Inc. Shareholders
headline.main: Meredith’s Persistence Pays Off for Time Inc. Shareholders

docs.snippet: The opacity of tech companies is matched by the efforts of some conservative media outlets to confuse and distract, leaving one to wonder how the nation will come together.

headline.print_headline: Closing Ranks, Murdoch Empire Sows Doubts on Russia Inquiry
headline.main: Russia Inquiry Fails to Unite a Nation

docs.snippet: Amid a big-tech backlash, the Silicon Valley giant announced funding over five years to nonprofits that help prepare workers for the digital economy.

headline.print_headline: Google Unveils $1 Billion Job Training Initiative
headline.main: Google Unveils Job Training Initiative With $1 Billion Pledge

docs.snippet: Nearly all big tech companies have an artificial intelligence project, and they are willing to pay experts millions of dollars to help get it done.

headline.main: Tech Giants Are Paying Huge Salaries for Scarce A.I. Talent

docs.snippet: The Kremlin’s stealth intrusion into the American election was broader than previously believed.
While some technology companies used their websites to proclaim support for equal internet access, some of the giants, including Google and Microsoft, were lying low.

headline.print_headline: Tech Giants Quiet as Neutrality Protests Move Online
headline.main: Net Neutrality Protests Move Online, Yet Big Tech Is Quiet
